meanings.definition: A triangular pediment above a portico in classical architecture.
meanings.sent1: The fronton of the building was beautifully decorated with intricate carvings.
meanings.sent2: The architect included a fronton in the design of the ancient temple.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel climbed up the fronton and peeked over the edge.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a fronton, perfectly framing her face with elegance.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight illuminated the fronton, casting a shadow on the entrance below.

meanings.definition: A game similar to jai alai, played on a three-walled court with a ball and a curved wicker basket.
meanings.sent1: The players practiced their aim by throwing the ball against the fronton.
meanings.sent2: Spectators cheered as the ball bounced off the fronton during the intense match.
meanings.sent3: The fronton seemed to have a mind of its own, sending the ball in unexpected directions.
meanings.sent4: His reflexes were as quick as a fronton, catching the ball with ease.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the ball hitting the fronton echoed through the court, adding to the excitement.
